text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
To know wisdom and instruction,
To discern the sayings of understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To receive instruction in wise behavior,
Righteousness, justice, and integrity;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To give prudence to the naive,
To the youth knowledge and discretion,
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise person will hear and increase in learning,
And a person of understanding will acquire wise counsel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To understand a proverb and a saying,
The words of the wise and their riddles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge;
Fools despise wisdom and instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction,
And do not ignore your mother’s teaching;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are a graceful wreath for your head
And necklaces for your neck.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if sinners entice you,
Do not consent.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let’s swallow them alive like Sheol,
Even whole, like those who go down to the pit;
speaker: Narrator

text:
We will find all kinds of precious wealth,
We will fill our houses with plunder;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Throw in your lot with us;
We will all have one money bag,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, do not walk on the way with them.
Keep your feet from their path,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their feet run to evil,
And they are quick to shed blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, it is useless to spread the baited net
In the sight of any bird;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they lie in wait for their own blood;
They ambush their own lives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such are the ways of everyone who makes unjust gain;
It takes away the life of its possessors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom shouts in the street,
She raises her voice in the public square;
speaker: Narrator

text:
At the head of the noisy streets she cries out;
At the entrance of the gates in the city she declares her sayings:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“How long, you naive ones, will you love simplistic thinking?
And how long will scoffers delight themselves in scoffing
And fools hate knowledge?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Because I called and you refused,
I stretched out my hand and no one paid attention;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you neglected all my advice
And did not want my rebuke;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also laugh at your disaster;
I will mock when your dread comes,
speaker: Narrator

text:
When your dread comes like a storm
And your disaster comes like a whirlwind,
When distress and anguish come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they will call on me, but I will not answer;
They will seek me diligently but will not find me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because they hated knowledge
And did not choose the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They did not accept my advice,
They disdainfully rejected every rebuke from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they shall eat of the fruit of their own way,
And be filled with their own schemes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the faithlessness of the naive will kill them,
And the complacency of fools will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But whoever listens to me will live securely
And will be at ease from the dread of evil.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if you will receive my words
And treasure my commandments within you,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make your ear attentive to wisdom;
Incline your heart to understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For if you cry out for insight,
And raise your voice for understanding;
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you seek her as silver
And search for her as for hidden treasures;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will understand the fear of the Lord,
And discover the knowledge of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord gives wisdom;
From His mouth come knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He stores up sound wisdom for the upright;
He is a shield to those who walk in integrity,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guarding the paths of justice,
And He watches over the way of His godly ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will discern righteousness, justice,
And integrity, and every good path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For wisdom will enter your heart,
And knowledge will be delightful to your soul;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Discretion will watch over you,
Understanding will guard you,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To rescue you from the way of evil,
From a person who speaks perverse things;
speaker: Narrator

text:
From those who leave the paths of uprightness
To walk in the ways of darkness;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who delight in doing evil
And rejoice in the perversity of evil;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whose paths are crooked,
And who are devious in their ways;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To rescue you from the strange woman,
From the foreign woman who flatters with her words,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who leaves the companion of her youth
And forgets the covenant of her God;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For her house sinks down to death,
And her tracks lead to the dead;
speaker: Narrator

text:
None who go to her return,
Nor do they reach the paths of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So you will walk in the way of good people
And keep to the paths of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the upright will live in the land,
And the blameless will remain in it;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the wicked will be eliminated from the land,
And the treacherous will be torn away from it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
But have your heart comply with my commandments;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For length of days and years of life
And peace they will add to you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So you will find favor and a good reputation
In the sight of God and man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart
And do not lean on your own understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In all your ways acknowledge Him,
And He will make your paths straight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
Fear the Lord and turn away from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be healing to your body
And refreshment to your bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor the Lord from your wealth,
And from the first of all your produce;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then your barns will be filled with plenty,
And your vats will overflow with new wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, do not reject the discipline of the Lord
Or loathe His rebuke,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For whom the Lord loves He disciplines,
Just as a father disciplines the son in whom he delights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is a person who finds wisdom,
And one who obtains understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For her profit is better than the profit of silver,
And her produce better than gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is more precious than jewels,
And nothing you desire compares with her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Long life is in her right hand;
In her left hand are riches and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her ways are pleasant ways,
And all her paths are peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her,
And happy are those who hold on to her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord founded the earth by wisdom,
He established the heavens by understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By His knowledge the ocean depths were burst open,
And the clouds drip with dew.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, see that they do not escape from your sight;
Comply with sound wisdom and discretion,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they will be life to your soul
And adornment to your neck.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will walk in your way securely,
And your foot will not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you lie down, you will not be afraid;
When you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be afraid of sudden danger,
Nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will be your confidence,
And will keep your foot from being caught.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,
When it is in your power to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back,
And tomorrow I will give it to you,”
When you have it with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not devise harm against your neighbor,
While he lives securely beside you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not contend with a person for no reason,
If he has done you no harm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not envy a violent person,
And do not choose any of his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the devious are an abomination to the Lord;
But He is intimate with the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The curse of the Lord is on the house of the wicked,
But He blesses the home of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though He scoffs at the scoffers,
Yet He gives grace to the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise will inherit honor,
But fools increase dishonor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, my sons, to the instruction of a father,
And pay attention so that you may gain understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I give you good teaching;
Do not abandon my instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I was a son to my father,
Tender and the only son in the sight of my mother,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Acquire wisdom! Acquire understanding!
Do not forget nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not abandon her, and she will guard you;
Love her, and she will watch over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The beginning of wisdom is: Acquire wisdom;
And with all your possessions, acquire understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Prize her, and she will exalt you;
She will honor you if you embrace her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She will place on your head a garland of grace;
She will present you with a crown of beauty.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, my son, and accept my sayings,
And the years of your life will be many.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have instructed you in the way of wisdom;
I have led you in upright paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you walk, your steps will not be hampered;
And if you run, you will not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take hold of instruction; do not let go.
Guard her, for she is your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not enter the path of the wicked
And do not proceed in the way of evil people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Avoid it, do not pass by it;
Turn away from it and pass on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they cannot sleep unless they do evil;
And they are robbed of sleep unless they make someone stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they eat the bread of wickedness,
And drink the wine of violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn
That shines brighter and brighter until the full day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of the wicked is like darkness;
They do not know over what they stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, pay attention to my words;
Incline your ear to my sayings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are not to escape from your sight;
Keep them in the midst of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are life to those who find them,
And healing to all their body.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Watch over your heart with all diligence,
For from it flow the springs of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rid yourself of a deceitful mouth
And keep devious speech far from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your eyes look directly ahead
And let your gaze be fixed straight in front of you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Watch the path of your feet,
And all your ways will be established.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not turn to the right or to the left;
Turn your foot from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, pay attention to my wisdom,
Incline your ear to my understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that you may maintain discretion
And your lips may comply with knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the lips of an adulteress drip honey,
And her speech is smoother than oil;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But in the end she is bitter as wormwood,
Sharp as a two-edged sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her feet go down to death,
Her steps take hold of Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She does not ponder the path of life;
Her ways are unstable, she does not know it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now then, my sons, listen to me
And do not turn away from the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your way far from her,
And do not go near the door of her house,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Otherwise you will give your vigor to others,
And your years to the cruel one;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And strangers will be filled with your strength,
And your hard-earned possessions will go to the house of a foreigner;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you will groan in the end,
When your flesh and your body are consumed;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you say, “How I hated instruction!
And my heart disdainfully rejected rebuke!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I did not listen to the voice of my teachers,
Nor incline my ear to my instructors!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was almost in total ruin
In the midst of the assembly and congregation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Drink water from your own cistern,
And fresh water from your own well.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Should your springs overflow into the street,
Streams of water in the public squares?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be yours alone,
And not for strangers with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your fountain be blessed,
And rejoice in the wife of your youth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For why should you, my son, be exhilarated with an adulteress,
And embrace the breasts of a foreigner?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the ways of everyone are before the eyes of the Lord,
And He observes all his paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His own wrongdoings will trap the wicked,
And he will be held by the ropes of his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will die for lack of instruction,
And in the greatness of his foolishness he will go astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if you have become a guarantor for your neighbor,
Or have given a handshake for a stranger,
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you have been ensnared by the words of your mouth,
Or caught by the words of your mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then do this, my son, and save yourself:
Since you have come into the hand of your neighbor,
Go, humble yourself, and be urgent with your neighbor to free yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give no sleep to your eyes,
Nor slumber to your eyelids;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save yourself like a gazelle from the hunter’s hand,
And like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go to the ant, you lazy one,
Observe its ways and be wise,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Which, having no chief,
Officer, or ruler,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Prepares its food in the summer
And gathers its provision in the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long will you lie down, you lazy one?
When will you arise from your sleep?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A little sleep, a little slumber,
A little folding of the hands to rest,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then your poverty will come in like a drifter,
And your need like an armed man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A worthless person, a wicked man,
Is one who walks with a perverse mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet,
Who points with his fingers;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who, with perversion in his heart, continually devises evil,
Who spreads strife.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore his disaster will come suddenly;
Instantly he will be broken and there will be no healing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There are six things that the Lord hates,
Seven that are an abomination to Him:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
And hands that shed innocent blood,
speaker: Narrator

text:
A heart that devises wicked plans,
Feet that run rapidly to evil,
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness who declares lies,
And one who spreads strife among brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, comply with the commandment of your father,
And do not ignore the teaching of your mother;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bind them continually on your heart;
Tie them around your neck.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching is light;
And rebukes for discipline are the way of life
speaker: Narrator

text:
To keep you from the evil woman,
From the smooth tongue of the foreign woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not desire her beauty in your heart,
Nor let her capture you with her eyelids.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the price of a prostitute reduces one to a loaf of bread,
And an adulteress hunts for a precious life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can anyone take fire in his lap
And his clothes not be burned?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Or can a person walk on hot coals
And his feet not be scorched?
speaker: Narrator

text:
So is the one who goes in to his neighbor’s wife;
Whoever touches her will not go unpunished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
People do not despise a thief if he steals
To satisfy himself when he is hungry;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But when he is found, he must repay seven times as much;
He must give up all the property of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who commits adultery with a woman is lacking sense;
He who would destroy himself commits it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will find wounds and disgrace,
And his shame will not be removed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For jealousy enrages a man,
And he will not have compassion on the day of vengeance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not accept any settlement,
Nor will he be satisfied though you make it a large gift.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, keep my words
And treasure my commandments within you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep my commandments and live,
And my teaching as the apple of your eye.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bind them on your fingers;
Write them on the tablet of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
And call understanding your intimate friend,
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that they may keep you from an adulteress,
From the foreigner who flatters with her words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For at the window of my house
I looked out through my lattice,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I saw among the naive,
And discerned among the youths
A young man lacking sense,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Passing through the street near her corner;
And he walks along the way to her house,
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the twilight, in the evening,
In the middle of the night and the darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And behold, a woman comes to meet him,
Dressed as a prostitute and cunning of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is boisterous and rebellious,
Her feet do not remain at home;
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is now in the streets, now in the public squares,
And lurks by every corner.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So she seizes him and kisses him,
And with a brazen face she says to him:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I was due to offer peace offerings;
Today I have paid my vows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I have come out to meet you,
To seek your presence diligently, and I have found you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have spread my couch with coverings,
With colored linens of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sprinkled my bed
With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, let’s drink our fill of love until morning;
Let’s delight ourselves with caresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my husband is not at home;
He has gone on a long journey.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has taken a bag of money with him.
At the full moon he will come home.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
With her many persuasions she entices him;
With her flattering lips she seduces him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Suddenly he follows her
As an ox goes to the slaughter,
Or as one walks in ankle bracelets to the discipline of a fool,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Now therefore, my sons, listen to me,
And pay attention to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways,
Do not stray into her paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For many are the victims she has brought to ruin,
And numerous are all those slaughtered by her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her house is the way to Sheol,
Descending to the chambers of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does not wisdom call,
And understanding raise her voice?
speaker: Narrator

text:
On top of the heights beside the way,
Where the paths meet, she takes her stand;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beside the gates, at the opening to the city,
At the entrance of the doors, she cries out:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“To you, people, I call,
And my voice is to mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You naive ones, understand prudence;
And, you fools, understand wisdom!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, for I will speak noble things;
And the opening of my lips will reveal right things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my mouth will proclaim truth;
And wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the words of my mouth are in righteousness;
There is nothing crooked or perverted in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are all straightforward to him who understands,
And right to those who find knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Accept my instruction and not silver,
And knowledge rather than choice gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For wisdom is better than jewels;
And all desirable things cannot compare with her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I, wisdom, dwell with prudence,
And I find knowledge and discretion.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Advice is mine and sound wisdom;
I am understanding, power is mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By me kings reign,
And rulers decree justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By me princes rule, and nobles,
All who judge rightly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love those who love me;
And those who diligently seek me will find me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Riches and honor are with me,
Enduring wealth and righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My fruit is better than gold, even pure gold;
And my yield better than choice silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I walk in the way of righteousness,
In the midst of the paths of justice,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To endow those who love me with wealth,
That I may fill their treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The Lord created me at the beginning of His way,
Before His works of old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From eternity I was established,
From the beginning, from the earliest times of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When there were no ocean depths, I was born,
When there were no springs abounding with water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before the mountains were settled,
Before the hills, I was born;
speaker: Narrator

text:
While He had not yet made the earth and the fields,
Nor the first dust of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When He established the heavens, I was there;
When He inscribed a circle on the face of the deep,
speaker: Narrator

text:
When He made firm the skies above,
When the springs of the deep became fixed,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Rejoicing in the world, His earth,
And having my delight in the sons of mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now then, sons, listen to me,
For blessed are those who keep my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to instruction and be wise,
And do not neglect it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the person who listens to me,
Watching daily at my gates,
Waiting at my doorposts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For one who finds me finds life,
And obtains favor from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But one who sins against me injures himself;
All those who hate me love death.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom has built her house,
She has carved out her seven pillars;
speaker: Narrator

text:
She has prepared her food, she has mixed her wine;
She has also set her table;
speaker: Narrator

text:
She has sent out her attendants, she calls out
From the tops of the heights of the city:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Whoever is naive, let him turn in here!”
To him who lacks understanding she says,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Come, eat of my food
And drink of the wine I have mixed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Abandon your foolishness and live,
And proceed in the way of understanding.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who corrects a scoffer gets dishonor for himself,
And one who rebukes a wicked person gets insults for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not rebuke a scoffer, or he will hate you;
Rebuke a wise person and he will love you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give instruction to a wise person and he will become still wiser;
Teach a righteous person and he will increase his insight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by me your days will be multiplied,
And years of life will be added to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
And if you scoff, you alone will suffer from it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A woman of foolishness is boisterous,
She has a lack of understanding and knows nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She sits at the doorway of her house,
On a seat by the high places of the city,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Calling to those who pass by,
Who are going straight on their paths:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Whoever is naive, let him turn in here,”
And to him who lacks understanding she says,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Stolen water is sweet;
And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he does not know that the dead are there,
That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The proverbs of Solomon.
A wise son makes a father glad,
But a foolish son is a grief to his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ill-gotten gains do not benefit,
But righteousness rescues from death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will not allow the righteous to hunger,
But He will reject the craving of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Poor is one who works with a lazy hand,
But the hand of the diligent makes rich.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who gathers in summer is a son who acts wisely,
But he who sleeps in harvest is a son who acts shamefully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessings are on the head of the righteous,
But the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mentioning of the righteous is a blessing,
But the name of the wicked will rot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise of heart will receive commands,
But a babbling fool will come to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who walks in integrity walks securely,
But one who perverts his ways will be found out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who winks the eye causes trouble,
And a babbling fool will come to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
But the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hatred stirs up strife,
But love covers all offenses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the lips of the discerning, wisdom is found,
But a rod is for the back of him who has no sense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wise people store up knowledge,
But with the mouth of the foolish, ruin is at hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich person’s wealth is his fortress,
The ruin of the poor is their poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wages of the righteous is life,
The income of the wicked, punishment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is on the path of life follows instruction,
But one who ignores a rebuke goes astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who conceals hatred has lying lips,
And one who spreads slander is a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When there are many words, wrongdoing is unavoidable,
But one who restrains his lips is wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The tongue of the righteous is like choice silver,
The heart of the wicked is worth little.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lips of the righteous feed many,
But fools die for lack of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is the blessing of the Lord that makes rich,
And He adds no sorrow to it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Doing wickedness is like sport to a fool,
And so is wisdom to a person of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What the wicked fears will come upon him,
But the desire of the righteous will be granted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more,
But the righteous has an everlasting foundation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
So is the lazy one to those who send him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord prolongs life,
But the years of the wicked will be shortened.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The hope of the righteous is gladness,
But the expectation of the wicked perishes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of the Lord is a stronghold for the upright,
But ruin to the workers of injustice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous will never be shaken,
But the wicked will not live in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the righteous flows with wisdom,
But the perverted tongue will be cut out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,
But the mouth of the wicked, what is perverted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false balance is an abomination to the Lord,
But a just weight is His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When pride comes, then comes dishonor;
But with the humble there is wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The integrity of the upright will guide them,
But the perversity of the treacherous will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Riches do not benefit on the day of wrath,
But righteousness rescues from death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteousness of the blameless will smooth his way,
But the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteousness of the upright will rescue them,
But the treacherous will be caught by their own greed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When a wicked person dies, his expectation will perish,
And the hope of strong people perishes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous is rescued from trouble,
But the wicked takes his place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With his mouth the godless person destroys his neighbor,
But through knowledge the righteous will be rescued.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When things go well for the righteous, the city rejoices,
And when the wicked perish, there is joyful shouting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted,
But by the mouth of the wicked, it is torn down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who despises his neighbor lacks sense,
But a person of understanding keeps silent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who goes about as a slanderer reveals secrets,
But one who is trustworthy conceals a matter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where there is no guidance the people fall,
But in an abundance of counselors there is victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is a guarantor for a stranger will certainly suffer for it,
But one who hates being a guarantor is secure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A gracious woman attains honor,
And ruthless men attain riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A merciful person does himself good,
But the cruel person does himself harm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked person earns deceptive wages,
But one who sows righteousness gets a true reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is steadfast in righteousness attains life,
But one who pursues evil attains his own death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The perverse in heart are an abomination to the Lord,
But the blameless in their walk are His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be assured, the evil person will not go unpunished,
But the descendants of the righteous will be rescued.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a ring of gold in a pig’s snout
So is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The desire of the righteous is only good,
But the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is one who scatters, and yet increases all the more,
And there is one who withholds what is justly due, and yet it results only in poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A generous person will be prosperous,
And one who gives others plenty of water will himself be given plenty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who withholds grain, the people will curse him,
But blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who diligently seeks good seeks favor,
But one who seeks evil, evil will come to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who trusts in his riches will fall,
But the righteous will flourish like the green leaf.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who troubles his own house will inherit wind,
And the foolish will be servant to the wise-hearted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
And one who is wise gains souls.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the righteous will be repaid on the earth,
How much more the wicked and the sinner!
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who loves discipline loves knowledge,
But one who hates rebuke is stupid.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A good person will obtain favor from the Lord,
But He will condemn a person who devises evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person will not be established by wickedness,
But the root of the righteous will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An excellent wife is the crown of her husband,
But she who shames him is like rottenness in his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The thoughts of the righteous are just,
But the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of the wicked wait in ambush for blood,
But the mouth of the upright will rescue them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are overthrown and are no more,
But the house of the righteous will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person will be praised according to his insight,
But one of perverse mind will be despised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is one who is lightly esteemed and has a servant,
Than one who honors himself and lacks bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A righteous person has regard for the life of his animal,
But even the compassion of the wicked is cruel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who works his land will have plenty of bread,
But one who pursues worthless things lacks sense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked person desires the plunder of evil people,
But the root of the righteous yields fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An evil person is ensnared by the offense of his lips,
But the righteous will escape from trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his words,
And the deeds of a person’s hands will return to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
But a person who listens to advice is wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool’s anger is known at once,
But a prudent person conceals dishonor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who declares truth tells what is right,
But a false witness, deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is one who speaks rashly like the thrusts of a sword,
But the tongue of the wise brings healing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truthful lips will endure forever,
But a lying tongue is only for a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil,
But counselors of peace have joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No harm happens to the righteous,
But the wicked are filled with trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord,
But those who deal faithfully are His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A prudent person conceals knowledge,
But the heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The hand of the diligent will rule,
But the lazy hand will be put to forced labor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Anxiety in a person’s heart weighs it down,
But a good word makes it glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous person is a guide to his neighbor,
But the way of the wicked leads them astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A lazy person does not roast his prey,
But the precious possession of a person is diligence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the way of righteousness there is life,
And in its pathway there is no death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise son accepts his father’s discipline,
But a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the fruit of a person’s mouth he enjoys good,
But the desire of the treacherous is violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who guards his mouth protects his life;
One who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The soul of the lazy one craves and gets nothing,
But the soul of the diligent is made prosperous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A righteous person hates a false statement,
But a wicked person acts disgustingly and shamefully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteousness guards the one whose way is blameless,
But wickedness brings the sinner to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is one who pretends to be rich but has nothing;
Another pretends to be poor, but has great wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The ransom of a person’s life is his wealth,
But the poor hears no rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The light of the righteous rejoices,
But the lamp of the wicked goes out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through overconfidence comes nothing but strife,
But wisdom is with those who receive counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth obtained from nothing dwindles,
But one who gathers by labor increases it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
But desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who despises the word will do badly,
But one who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
To turn aside from the snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Good understanding produces favor,
But the way of the treacherous is their own disaster.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every prudent person acts with knowledge,
But a fool displays foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked messenger falls into adversity,
But a faithful messenger brings healing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Poverty and shame will come to one who neglects discipline,
But one who complies with rebuke will be honored.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Desire realized is sweet to the soul,
But it is an abomination to fools to turn away from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who walks with wise people will be wise,
But a companion of fools will suffer harm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Adversity pursues sinners,
But the righteous will be rewarded with prosperity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A good person leaves an inheritance to his grandchildren,
And the wealth of a sinner is stored up for the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Abundant food is in the uncultivated ground of the poor,
But it is swept away by injustice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who withholds his rod hates his son,
But he who loves him disciplines him diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous has enough to satisfy his appetite,
But the stomach of the wicked is in need.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise woman builds her house,
But the foolish tears it down with her own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who walks in his uprightness fears the Lord,
But one who is devious in his ways despises Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the mouth of the foolish is a rod for his back,
But the lips of the wise will protect them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where there are no oxen, the manger is clean;
But much revenue comes by the strength of the ox.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A trustworthy witness will not lie,
But a false witness declares lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A scoffer seeks wisdom and finds none,
But knowledge is easy for one who has understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Leave the presence of a fool,
Or you will not discern words of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wisdom of the sensible is to understand his way,
But the foolishness of fools is deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fools mock at sin,
But among the upright there is goodwill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart knows its own bitterness,
And a stranger does not share its joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
But the tent of the upright will flourish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is a way which seems right to a person,
But its end is the way of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even in laughter the heart may be in pain,
And the end of joy may be grief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One with a wayward heart will have his fill of his own ways,
But a good person will be satisfied with his.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The naive believes everything,
But the sensible person considers his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise person is cautious and turns away from evil,
But a fool is arrogant and careless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A quick-tempered person acts foolishly,
And a person of evil devices is hated.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The naive inherit foolishness,
But the sensible are crowned with knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The evil will bow down before the good,
And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The poor is hated even by his neighbor,
But those who love the rich are many.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who despises his neighbor sins,
But one who is gracious to the poor is blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will they who devise evil not go astray?
But kindness and truth will be to those who devise good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In all labor there is profit,
But mere talk leads only to poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The crown of the wise is their riches,
But the foolishness of fools is simply foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A truthful witness saves lives,
But one who declares lies is deceitful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the fear of the Lord there is strong confidence,
And his children will have refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,
By which one may avoid the snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In a multitude of people is a king’s glory,
But in the scarcity of people is a prince’s ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is slow to anger has great understanding;
But one who is quick-tempered exalts foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A tranquil heart is life to the body,
But jealousy is rottenness to the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who oppresses the poor taunts his Maker,
But one who is gracious to the needy honors Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked is thrust down by his own wrongdoing,
But the righteous has a refuge when he dies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding,
But among fools it is made known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteousness exalts a nation,
But sin is a disgrace to any people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king’s favor is toward a servant who acts wisely,
But his anger is toward him who acts shamefully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A gentle answer turns away wrath,
But a harsh word stirs up anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The tongue of the wise makes knowledge pleasant,
But the mouth of fools spouts foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
Watching the evil and the good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A soothing tongue is a tree of life,
But perversion in it crushes the spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool rejects his father’s discipline,
But he who complies with rebuke is sensible.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great wealth is in the house of the righteous,
But trouble is in the income of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lips of the wise spread knowledge,
But the hearts of fools are not so.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
But the prayer of the upright is His delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
But He loves the one who pursues righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is severe punishment for one who abandons the way;
One who hates a rebuke will die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sheol and Abaddon lie open before the Lord,
How much more the hearts of mankind!
speaker: Narrator

text:
A scoffer does not love one who rebukes him;
He will not go to the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A joyful heart makes a cheerful face,
But when the heart is sad, the spirit is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mind of the intelligent seeks knowledge,
But the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the days of the needy are bad,
But a cheerful heart has a continual feast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a little with the fear of the Lord
Than great treasure, and turmoil with the treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a portion of vegetables where there is love,
Than a fattened ox served with hatred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A hot-tempered person stirs up strife,
But the slow to anger calms a dispute.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of the lazy one is like a hedge of thorns,
But the path of the upright is a highway.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise son makes a father glad,
But a foolish man despises his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foolishness is joy to one who lacks sense,
But a person of understanding walks straight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Without consultation, plans are frustrated,
But with many counselors they succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person has joy in an apt answer,
And how delightful is a timely word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The path of life leads upward for the wise,
So that he may keep away from Sheol below.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will tear down the house of the proud,
But He will set the boundary of the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evil plans are an abomination to the Lord,
But pleasant words are pure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who profits illicitly troubles his own house,
But he who hates bribes will live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart of the righteous ponders how to answer,
But the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is far from the wicked,
But He hears the prayer of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bright eyes gladden the heart;
Good news refreshes the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One whose ear listens to a life-giving rebuke
Will stay among the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who neglects discipline rejects himself,
But one who listens to a rebuke acquires understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is the instruction for wisdom,
And before honor comes humility.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The plans of the heart belong to a person,
But the answer of the tongue is from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the ways of a person are clean in his own sight,
But the Lord examines the motives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Commit your works to the Lord,
And your plans will be established.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has made everything for its own purpose,
Even the wicked for the day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord;
Be assured, he will not go unpunished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By mercy and truth atonement is made for wrongdoing,
And by the fear of the Lord one keeps away from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When a person’s ways are pleasing to the Lord,
He causes even his enemies to make peace with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a little with righteousness
Than great income with injustice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mind of a person plans his way,
But the Lord directs his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A divine verdict is on the lips of the king;
His mouth should not err in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A just balance and scales belong to the Lord;
All the weights of the bag are His concern.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is an abomination for kings to commit wicked acts,
Because a throne is established on righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous lips are the delight of kings,
And one who speaks right is loved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fury of a king is like messengers of death;
But a wise person will appease it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the light of a king’s face is life,
And his favor is like a cloud with the spring rain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How much better it is to get wisdom than gold!
And to get understanding is to be chosen above silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The highway of the upright is to turn away from evil;
One who watches his way protects his life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pride goes before destruction,
And a haughty spirit before stumbling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to be humble in spirit with the needy
Than to divide the spoils with the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who pays attention to the word will find good,
And blessed is one who trusts in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wise in heart will be called understanding,
And sweetness of speech increases persuasiveness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Understanding is a fountain of life to those who have it,
But the discipline of fools is foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart of the wise instructs his mouth
And adds persuasiveness to his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pleasant words are a honeycomb,
Sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is a way which seems right to a person,
But its end is the way of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A worker’s appetite works for him,
For his hunger urges him on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A worthless person digs up evil,
While his words are like scorching fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A perverse person spreads strife,
And a slanderer separates close friends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person of violence entices his neighbor
And leads him in a way that is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who winks his eyes does so to devise perverse things;
He who compresses his lips brings evil to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A gray head is a crown of glory;
It is found in the way of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty,
And one who rules his spirit, than one who captures a city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lot is cast into the lap,
But its every decision is from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a dry morsel and quietness with it
Than a house full of feasting with strife.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A servant who acts wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully,
And will share in the inheritance among brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold,
But the Lord tests hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An evildoer listens to wicked lips;
A liar pays attention to a destructive tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who mocks the poor taunts his Maker;
One who rejoices at disaster will not go unpunished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Grandchildren are the crown of the old,
And the glory of sons is their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Excellent speech is not fitting for a fool,
Much less are lying lips to a prince.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A bribe is a charm in the sight of its owner;
Wherever he turns, he prospers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who conceals an offense seeks love,
But one who repeats a matter separates close friends.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A rebuke goes deeper into one who has understanding
Than a hundred blows into a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A rebellious person seeks only evil,
So a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let a person meet a bear robbed of her cubs,
Rather than a fool in his foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who returns evil for good,
Evil will not depart from his house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The beginning of strife is like letting out water,
So abandon the quarrel before it breaks out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who justifies the wicked and one who condemns the righteous,
Both of them alike are an abomination to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why is there money in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom,
When he has no sense?
speaker: Narrator

text:
A friend loves at all times,
And a brother is born for adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person lacking in sense shakes hands
And becomes guarantor in the presence of his neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who loves wrongdoing loves strife;
One who makes his doorway high seeks destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who has a crooked mind finds nothing good,
And one who is corrupted in his language falls into evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who fathers a fool does so to his sorrow,
And the father of a fool has no joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A joyful heart is good medicine,
But a broken spirit dries up the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked person accepts a bribe from an inside pocket
To pervert the ways of justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom is in the presence of one who has understanding,
But the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A foolish son is a grief to his father,
And bitterness to her who gave birth to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is also not good to fine the righteous,
Nor to strike the noble for their uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who withholds his words has knowledge,
And one who has a cool spirit is a person of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is considered wise;
When he closes his lips, he is considered prudent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who separates himself seeks his own desire;
He quarrels against all sound wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool does not delight in understanding,
But in revealing his own mind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When a wicked person comes, contempt also comes,
And with dishonor comes taunting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of a person’s mouth are deep waters;
The fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To show partiality to the wicked is not good,
Nor to suppress the righteous in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool’s lips bring strife,
And his mouth invites beatings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fool’s mouth is his ruin,
And his lips are the snare of his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of a gossiper are like dainty morsels,
And they go down into the innermost parts of the body.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also who is lax in his work
Is a brother to him who destroys.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower;
The righteous runs into it and is safe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A rich person’s wealth is his strong city,
And like a high wall in his own imagination.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before destruction the heart of a person is haughty,
But humility goes before honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who gives an answer before he hears,
It is foolishness and shame to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The spirit of a person can endure his sickness,
But as for a broken spirit, who can endure it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mind of the discerning acquires knowledge,
And the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person’s gift makes room for him
And brings him before great people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The first to plead his case seems right,
Until another comes and examines him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cast lot puts an end to quarrels,
And decides between the mighty ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A brother who is offended is harder to be won than a strong city,
And quarrels are like the bars of a citadel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the fruit of a person’s mouth his stomach will be satisfied;
He will be satisfied with the product of his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
And those who love it will eat its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who finds a wife finds a good thing
And obtains favor from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A poor person utters pleadings,
But a rich person answers defiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person of too many friends comes to ruin,
But there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity
Than a person who is perverse in speech and is a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also it is not good for a person to be without knowledge,
And one who hurries his footsteps errs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The foolishness of a person ruins his way,
And his heart rages against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth adds many friends,
But a poor person is separated from his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
And one who declares lies will not escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many will seek the favor of a generous person,
And every person is a friend to him who gives gifts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
One who gets wisdom loves his own soul;
One who keeps understanding will find good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
And one who declares lies will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Luxury is not fitting for a fool;
Much less for a slave to rule over princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person’s discretion makes him slow to anger,
And it is his glory to overlook an offense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion,
But his favor is like dew on the grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A foolish son is destruction to his father,
And the quarrels of a wife are a constant dripping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
House and wealth are an inheritance from fathers,
But a prudent wife is from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Laziness casts one into a deep sleep,
And a lazy person will suffer hunger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who keeps the commandment keeps his soul,
But one who is careless of conduct will die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is gracious to a poor person lends to the Lord,
And He will repay him for his good deed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Discipline your son while there is hope,
And do not desire his death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person of great anger will suffer the penalty,
For if you rescue him, you will only have to do it again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to advice and accept discipline,
So that you may be wise the rest of your days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many plans are in a person’s heart,
But the advice of the Lord will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What is desirable in a person is his kindness,
And it is better to be a poor person than a liar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord leads to life,
So that one may sleep satisfied, untouched by evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lazy one buries his hand in the dish,
But will not even bring it back to his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strike a scoffer and the naive may become clever,
But rebuke one who has understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who assaults his father and drives his mother away
Is a shameful and disgraceful son.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stop listening, my son, to discipline,
And you will stray from the words of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A worthless witness makes a mockery of justice,
And the mouth of the wicked swallows wrongdoing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judgments are prepared for scoffers,
And beatings for the backs of fools.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wine is a mocker, intoxicating drink a brawler,
And whoever is intoxicated by it is not wise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The terror of a king is like the roaring of a lion;
One who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Avoiding strife is an honor for a person,
But any fool will quarrel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lazy one does not plow after the autumn,
So he begs during the harvest and has nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A plan in the heart of a person is like deep water,
But a person of understanding draws it out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many a person proclaims his own loyalty,
But who can find a trustworthy person?
speaker: Narrator

text:
A righteous person who walks in his integrity—
How blessed are his sons after him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A king who sits on the throne of justice
Disperses all evil with his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart,
I am pure from my sin”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Differing weights and differing measures,
Both of them are abominable to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is by his deeds that a boy distinguishes himself,
If his conduct is pure and right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The hearing ear and the seeing eye,
The Lord has made both of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not love sleep, or you will become poor;
Open your eyes, and you will be satisfied with food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Bad, bad,” says the buyer,
But when he goes his way, then he boasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is gold, and an abundance of jewels;
But lips of knowledge are a more precious thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take his garment when he becomes guarantor for a stranger;
And for foreigners, seize a pledge from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bread obtained by a lie is sweet to a person,
But afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Prepare plans by consultation,
And make war by wise guidance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who goes about as a slanderer reveals secrets;
Therefore do not associate with a gossip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who curses his father or his mother,
His lamp will go out in time of darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
An inheritance gained in a hurry at the beginning
Will not be blessed in the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not say, “I will repay evil”;
Wait for the Lord, and He will save you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Differing weights are an abomination to the Lord,
And a false scale is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A man’s steps are ordained by the Lord;
How then can a person understand his way?
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is a trap for a person to say carelessly, “It is holy!”
And after the vows to make inquiry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise king scatters the wicked,
And drives a threshing wheel over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The spirit of a person is the lamp of the Lord,
Searching all the innermost parts of his being.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Loyalty and truth watch over the king,
And he upholds his throne by loyalty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The glory of young men is their strength,
And the honor of old men is their gray hair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bruising wounds clean away evil,
And blows cleanse the innermost parts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king’s heart is like channels of water in the hand of the Lord;
He turns it wherever He pleases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every person’s way is right in his own eyes,
But the Lord examines the hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To do righteousness and justice
Is preferred by the Lord more than sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Haughty eyes and a proud heart,
The lamp of the wicked, is sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The plans of the diligent certainly lead to advantage,
But everyone who is in a hurry certainly comes to poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The acquisition of treasures by a lying tongue
Is a fleeting vapor, the pursuit of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,
Because they refuse to act with justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The way of a guilty person is crooked,
But as for the pure, his conduct is upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to live on a corner of a roof
Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The soul of the wicked desires evil;
His neighbor is shown no compassion in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the scoffer is punished, the naive becomes wise;
But when the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous one considers the house of the wicked,
Bringing the wicked to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who shuts his ear to the outcry of the poor
Will also call out himself, and not be answered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A gift in secret subdues anger,
And a bribe in an inside pocket, strong wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The exercise of justice is joy for the righteous,
But terror to those who practice injustice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A person who wanders from the way of understanding
Will rest in the assembly of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who loves pleasure will become a poor person;
One who loves wine and oil will not become rich.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked is a ransom for the righteous,
And the treacherous is in the place of the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to live in a desert land
Than with a contentious and irritating woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is precious treasure and oil in the home of the wise,
But a foolish person swallows it up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who pursues righteousness and loyalty
Finds life, righteousness, and honor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise person scales the city of the mighty
And brings down the stronghold in which they trust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who guards his mouth and his tongue,
Guards his soul from troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Proud,” “Arrogant,” “Scoffer,” are his names,
One who acts with insolent pride.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The desire of the lazy one puts him to death,
For his hands refuse to work;
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long he is craving,
While the righteous gives and does not hold back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination,
How much more when he brings it with evil intent!
speaker: Narrator

text:
A false witness will perish,
But a person who listens will speak forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wicked person displays a bold face,
But as for the upright, he makes his way sure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no wisdom, no understanding,
And no plan against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The horse is prepared for the day of battle,
But the victory belongs to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A good name is to be more desired than great wealth;
Favor is better than silver and gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich and the poor have a common bond,
The Lord is the Maker of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A prudent person sees evil and hides himself,
But the naive proceed, and pay the penalty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The reward of humility and the fear of the Lord
Are riches, honor, and life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse;
One who guards himself will be far from them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Train up a child in the way he should go,
Even when he grows older he will not abandon it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rich rules over the poor,
And the borrower becomes the lender’s slave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who sows injustice will reap disaster,
And the rod of his fury will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who is generous will be blessed,
Because he gives some of his food to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Drive out the scoffer, and strife will leave,
Even quarreling and dishonor will cease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who loves purity of heart
And whose speech is gracious, the king is his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord protect knowledge,
But He overthrows the words of the treacherous person.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lazy one says, “There is a lion outside;
I will be killed in the streets!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit;
He who is cursed of the Lord will fall into it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child;
The rod of discipline will remove it far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who oppresses the poor to make more for himself,
Or gives to the rich, will only come to poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Extend your ear and hear the words of the wise,
And apply your mind to my knowledge;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it will be pleasant if you keep them within you,
So that they may be ready on your lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that your trust may be in the Lord,
I have taught you today, you indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have I not written to you excellent things
Of counsels and knowledge,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To make you know the certainty of the words of truth,
So that you may correctly answer him who sent you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
Nor crush the needy at the gate;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will plead their case
And take the life of those who rob them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not make friends with a person given to anger,
Or go with a hot-tempered person,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Or you will learn his ways
And find a snare for yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be among those who shake hands,
Among those who become guarantors for debts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you have nothing with which to repay,
Why should he take your bed from under you?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not move the ancient boundary
Which your fathers have set.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When you sit down to dine with a ruler,
Consider carefully what is before you,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And put a knife to your throat
If you are a person of great appetite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not desire his delicacies,
For it is deceptive food.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not weary yourself to gain wealth;
Stop dwelling on it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you set your eyes on it, it is gone.
For wealth certainly makes itself wings
Like an eagle that flies toward the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not eat the bread of a selfish person;
Or desire his delicacies;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as he thinks within himself, so he is.
He says to you, “Eat and drink!”
But his heart is not with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will vomit up the morsel you have eaten
And waste your compliments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not speak to be heard by a fool,
For he will despise the wisdom of your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not move the ancient boundary
Or go into the fields of the fatherless,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their Redeemer is strong;
He will plead their case against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Apply your heart to discipline,
And your ears to words of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not withhold discipline from a child;
Though you strike him with the rod, he will not die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall strike him with the rod
And rescue his soul from Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, if your heart is wise,
My own heart also will be glad,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And my innermost being will rejoice
When your lips speak what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let your heart envy sinners,
But live in the fear of the Lord always.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly there is a future,
And your hope will not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, my son, and be wise,
And direct your heart in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be with heavy drinkers of wine,
Or with gluttonous eaters of meat;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the heavy drinker and the glutton will come to poverty,
And drowsiness will clothe one with rags.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to your father, who fathered you,
And do not despise your mother when she is old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Buy truth, and do not sell it,
Get wisdom, instruction, and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice,
And he who fathers a wise son will be glad in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your father and your mother be glad,
And let her rejoice who gave birth to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me your heart, my son,
And let your eyes delight in my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a prostitute is a deep pit,
And a strange woman is a narrow well.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly she lurks as a robber,
And increases the treacherous among mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has woe? Who has sorrow?
Who has contentions? Who has complaining?
Who has wounds without cause?
Who has red eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who linger long over wine,
Those who go to taste mixed wine.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
In the end it bites like a snake
And stings like a viper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your eyes will see strange things
And your mind will say perverse things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you will be like one who lies down in the middle of the sea,
Or like one who lies down on the top of a mast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“They struck me, but I did not become ill;
They beat me, but I did not know it.
When will I awake?
I will seek another drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be envious of evil people,
Nor desire to be with them;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their minds plot violence,
And their lips talk of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By wisdom a house is built,
And by understanding it is established;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And by knowledge the rooms are filled
With all precious and pleasant riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A wise man is strong,
And a person of knowledge increases power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by wise guidance you will wage war,
And in an abundance of counselors there is victory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wisdom is too exalted for a fool,
He does not open his mouth at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who plans to do evil,
People will call a schemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The devising of foolishness is sin,
And the scoffer is an abomination to humanity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you show yourself lacking courage on the day of distress,
Your strength is meager.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue those who are being taken away to death,
And those who are staggering to the slaughter, Oh hold them back!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If you say, “See, we did not know this,”
Does He who weighs the hearts not consider it?
And does He who watches over your soul not know it?
And will He not repay a person according to his work?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, eat honey, for it is good;
Yes, the honey from the comb is sweet to your taste;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not lie in ambush, you wicked person, against the home of the righteous;
Do not destroy his resting place;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a righteous person falls seven times and rises again,
But the wicked stumble in time of disaster.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not rejoice when your enemy falls,
And do not let your heart rejoice when he stumbles,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Otherwise, the Lord will see and be displeased,
And turn His anger away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not get upset because of evildoers
Or be envious of the wicked;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there will be no future for the evil person;
The lamp of the wicked will be put out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My son, fear the Lord and the king;
Do not get involved with those of high rank,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their disaster will rise suddenly,
And who knows the ruin that can come from both of them?
speaker: Narrator

text:
These also are sayings of the wise:
To show partiality in judgment is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who says to the wicked, “You are righteous,”
Peoples will curse him, nations will scold him;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But for those who rebuke the wicked there will be delight,
And a good blessing will come upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One who gives a right answer
Kisses the lips.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not be a witness against your neighbor for no reason,
And do not deceive with your lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not say, “I shall do the same to him as he has done to me;
I will repay the person according to his work.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I passed by the field of a lazy one,
And by the vineyard of a person lacking sense,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When I saw, I reflected upon it;
I looked, and received instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A little sleep, a little slumber,
A little folding of the hands to rest,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then your poverty will come like a drifter,
And your need like an armed man.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are proverbs of Solomon which the men of Hezekiah, king of Judah, transcribed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is the glory of God to conceal a matter,
But the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the heavens for height and the earth for depth,
So the heart of kings is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away the impurities from the silver,
And there comes out a vessel for the smith;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away the wicked before the king,
And his throne will be established in righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not boast in the presence of the king,
And do not stand in the same place as great people;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is better that it be said to you, “Come up here,”
Than for you to be placed lower in the presence of the prince,
Whom your eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Argue your case with your neighbor,
And do not reveal the secret of another,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Or one who hears it will put you to shame,
And the evil report about you will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like apples of gold in settings of silver,
Is a word spoken at the proper time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like an earring of gold and a jewelry piece of fine gold,
Is a wise person who offers rebukes to a listening ear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like the cold of snow in the time of harvest
Is a faithful messenger to those who send him,
For he refreshes the soul of his masters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like clouds and wind without rain
Is a person who boasts of his gifts falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through patience a ruler may be persuaded,
And a gentle tongue breaks bone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you found honey? Eat only what you need,
So that you do not have it in excess and vomit it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let your foot rarely be in your neighbor’s house,
Or he will become weary of you and hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a club, a sword, and a sharp arrow
Is a person who gives false testimony against his neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a bad tooth and an unsteady foot
Is confidence in a treacherous person in time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like one who takes off a garment on a cold day, or like vinegar on soda,
Is one who sings songs to a troubled heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat;
And if he is thirsty, give him water to drink;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will heap burning coals on his head,
And the Lord will reward you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The north wind brings rain,
And a gossiping tongue brings an angry face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to live on a corner of the roof,
Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like cold water to a weary soul,
So is good news from a distant land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a trampled spring and a polluted well,
So is a righteous person who gives way before the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is not good to eat much honey,
Nor is it glory to search out one’s own glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a city that is broken into and without walls
So is a person who has no self-control over his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like snow in summer and like rain in harvest,
So honor is not fitting for a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a sparrow in its flitting, like a swallow in its flying,
So a curse without cause does not come to rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A whip is for the horse, a bridle for the donkey,
And a rod for the back of fools.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not answer a fool according to his foolishness,
Or you will also be like him.
